intro: Silvorchis vietnamica, commonly known as the Vietnam orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to Vietnam. It is a terrestrial orchid with a distinctive appearance, featuring a slender, leafless stem and a single, showy flower. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, preferring rich, well-drained soil. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Silvorchis vietnamica is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
